role.descr: instrument, thing hit by or with

example.name: prepositional thing knocked
example.text: John knocked on Mary's door with his head.

example.name: unstated instrument
example.text: The strong dollar, which reduces the value of overseas earnings and revenue when they are translated into dollars, is expected *trace* to knock 80 to 85 cents off IBM's per-share earnings for the full year.

roleset.name: hit and cause to go down

example.name: just transitive
example.text: London share prices closed sharply lower Friday in active trading after Chancellor of the Exchequer Nigel Lawson's resignation slapped the market and Wall Street's rapid initial sell-off knocked it down.

example.name: with numeric arguments
example.text: Last Friday, takeover traders spilled out of Hilton, *trace* knocking the stock down 21 1/2 to 85.

example.name: with instrument
example.text: John knocked down Mary's door with his incessant pounding.
